backups.title: Database Backups
backups.description: Create, restore, and manage database backups
backups.restoreSuccess: You must restart the application for the database restore to finalise.
backups.confirmRestore: This will replace your database. A backup will be created first. Continue?

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.description: Customize how the application looks and feels.

language.label: Language
language.helper: Choose your preferred language. Browser Default follows your system language.

fonts.title: Typography
fonts.description: Customize the fonts used throughout the application.

uiFont.label: UI Font
uiFont.helper: Font used for menus, buttons, and general interface text.

codeFont.label: Code Font
codeFont.helper: Font used for code blocks, terminal output, and technical content.

proseFont.label: Prose Font
proseFont.helper: Font used for task descriptions and long-form text.

disableLigatures.label: Disable Ligatures
disableLigatures.helper: Turn off programming ligatures (like => and !==) in code fonts.

preview.title: Preview
preview.uiSample: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
preview.proseSample: Task descriptions and documentation appear like this.

devBanner.title: Development Banner
devBanner.description: Customize the appearance of the development mode banner.

backgroundColor.label: Background Color
backgroundColor.helper: Custom background color for the dev banner. Use any CSS color value (hex, rgb, named colors). Leave empty for default orange.

foregroundColor.label: Text Color
foregroundColor.helper: Custom text color for the dev banner. Use any CSS color value. Leave empty for default white.

showHostname.label: Show Hostname
showHostname.helper: Display the system hostname in the development banner.

showOsInfo.label: Show OS Information
showOsInfo.helper: Display the operating system type and version in the development banner.

taskExecution.title: Task Execution
taskExecution.description: Configure how tasks are executed and processed.

executor.label: Default Agent Configuration
executor.helper: Choose the default agent configuration to use when creating a task attempt.

type.label: Editor Type
type.helper: Choose your preferred code editor interface.

customCommand.label: Custom Editor Command
customCommand.helper: Enter the command to launch your custom editor. This will be used to open files.

host.label: Remote SSH Host (Optional)
host.helper: Set this if Vibe Kanban is running on a remote server. When set, clicking "Open in Editor" will generate a URL to open your editor via SSH instead of spawning a local command.

user.label: Remote SSH User (Optional)
user.helper: SSH username for the remote connection. If not set, VS Code will use your SSH config or prompt you.

cliSetup.title: GitHub CLI Setup
cliSetup.description: GitHub CLI authentication is required to create pull requests and interact with GitHub repositories.

steps.checkInstalled: Check if GitHub CLI (gh) is installed
steps.installHomebrew: Install it via Homebrew if needed (macOS)

cliSetup.setupNote: The setup will run in the chat window. You'll need to complete the authentication in your browser.

errors.brewMissing: Homebrew is not installed. Install it to enable automatic setup.
errors.notSupported: Automatic setup is not supported on this platform. Install GitHub CLI manually.
errors.setupFailed: Failed to run GitHub CLI setup.

homebrew.description: Automatic installation requires Homebrew. Install Homebrew from
homebrew.manualInstall: and then rerun the setup. Alternatively, install GitHub CLI manually with:

manual.andAuthenticate: and then authenticate with your GitHub account.

branchPrefix.label: Branch Prefix
branchPrefix.helper: Prefix for auto-generated branch names. Leave empty for no prefix.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Control when and how you receive notifications.

sound.label: Sound Notifications
sound.helper: Play a sound when task attempts finish running.
sound.fileHelper: Choose the sound to play when tasks complete. Click the volume button to preview.

push.label: Push Notifications
push.helper: Show system notifications when task attempts finish running.

taskTemplates.title: Templates
taskTemplates.description: Create reusable text snippets that can be inserted into task descriptions using @template_name.

manager.title: Task Templates
manager.noTemplates: No templates yet. Create reusable text snippets for common task descriptions. Use @template_name in any task.
manager.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the template "{{templateName}}"?

templateName.label: Template Name
templateName.hint: Use this name with @ in task descriptions: @{{templateName}}
templateName.error: Template name cannot contain spaces. Use underscores instead (e.g., my_template)

content.label: Content
content.hint: Text that will be inserted when you use @{{templateName}} in task descriptions
content.placeholder: Enter the text that will be inserted when you use this template

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Create visual labels for categorizing and organizing tasks.

manager.title: Task Labels
manager.noLabels: No labels yet. Create visual labels to categorize and organize your tasks.
manager.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the label "{{labelName}}"?

terminal.title: Terminal
terminal.description: Customize the in-browser terminal appearance and behavior.

fontSize.label: Font Size
fontSize.helper: Terminal font size in pixels. Changes apply to new terminals.

cursorBlink.label: Cursor Blink
cursorBlink.helper: Enable cursor blinking in the terminal.

timestamps.title: Timestamps
timestamps.description: Configure how execution timestamps are displayed in conversations.

timezone.label: Timezone
timezone.helper: Choose which timezone to use when displaying execution start and end times.

performance.title: Performance
performance.description: Configure log loading and display settings for optimal performance.

initialLoad.label: Initial Log Entries
initialLoad.helper: Number of log entries to load when first viewing a conversation. Lower values improve loading speed.

maxLimit.label: Maximum Entries Per Page
maxLimit.helper: Maximum number of log entries to load per pagination request.

safety.title: Safety & Disclaimers
safety.description: Reset acknowledgments for safety warnings and onboarding.

diskUsage.title: Disk Usage
diskUsage.description: Monitor and manage disk space used by worktrees.

agents.title: Coding Agent Configurations
agents.description: Customize the behavior of coding agents with different configurations.

availability.loginDetectedTooltip: Recent authentication credentials found for this agent
availability.installationFoundTooltip: Agent configuration found. You may need to log in to use it.
availability.notFoundTooltip: No previous usage detected. Agent may require installation and/or login.

errors.deleteFailed: Failed to delete configuration. Please try again.
errors.saveFailed: Failed to save agent configurations. Please try again.
errors.saveConfigFailed: Failed to save configuration. Please try again.

mcp.title: MCP Server Configuration
mcp.description: Configure Model Context Protocol servers to extend coding agent capabilities with custom tools and resources.

labels.agentHelper: Choose which agent to configure MCP servers for.
labels.serverHelper: Click a card to insert that MCP Server into the JSON above.

errors.applyFailed: Failed to apply MCP server configuration
errors.supportMessage: To use MCP servers, please select a different executor that supports MCP (Claude, Amp, Gemini, Codex, or Opencode) above.

swarm.title: Swarm Management
swarm.description: Manage shared projects, labels, and templates across your swarm nodes.
swarm.selectOrgHelper: Select the organization whose swarm settings you want to manage.

loginRequired.title: Sign in to manage swarm
loginRequired.description: Sign in to your account to manage swarm projects, labels, and templates across your organizations.

projects.title: Swarm Projects
projects.description: Manage shared projects across your swarm nodes. Link local projects to share tasks between nodes.
projects.noOrganization: Please select an organization to manage swarm projects.
projects.error: Failed to load swarm projects. Please try again.
projects.empty: No swarm projects yet. Create one to start sharing projects across nodes.
projects.noNodes: No nodes linked to this project yet.

dialog.createDescription: Create a new swarm project that can be linked to node projects.
dialog.editDescription: Update the project name and description.

deleteConfirm.title: Delete Swarm Project?
deleteConfirm.description: This will delete "{{name}}" and unlink all {{count}} nodes. This action cannot be undone.

merge.title: Merge Projects
merge.description: Merge another project into "{{target}}". All linked nodes will be transferred and the source project will be deleted.
merge.sourceRequired: Please select a project to merge
merge.noOtherProjects: No other projects available to merge.
merge.warning: "{{source}}" will be deleted after merging. This action cannot be undone.

labels.title: Swarm Labels
labels.description: Manage organization-wide labels that can be used across all swarm projects.
labels.noOrganization: Please select an organization to manage swarm labels.
labels.error: Failed to load swarm labels. Please try again.
labels.empty: No swarm labels yet. Create labels to categorize tasks across your organization.
labels.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the label "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

merge.title: Merge Labels
merge.description: Merge another label into "{{target}}". All tasks using the source label will be updated to use the target label.
merge.warning: "{{source}}" will be deleted after merging. This action cannot be undone.

templates.title: Swarm Templates
templates.description: Manage organization-wide templates for task descriptions using @mentions.
templates.noOrganization: Please select an organization to manage swarm templates.
templates.error: Failed to load swarm templates. Please try again.
templates.empty: No swarm templates yet. Create templates to reuse common task descriptions.
templates.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the template "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

dialog.nameHelper: Use this name with @ in task descriptions: @{{name}}
dialog.contentHelper: This text will be inserted when you use @template_name in task descriptions.

merge.title: Merge Templates
merge.description: Merge another template into "{{target}}". The source template content will be appended.
merge.warning: "{{source}}" will be deleted after merging. This action cannot be undone.

selector.label: Select Project
selector.helper: Select a project to view and edit its configuration.

name.label: Project Name
name.helper: A display name for this project.

repoPath.label: Git Repository Path
repoPath.helper: The absolute path to your git repository on disk.

scripts.title: Scripts & Configuration
scripts.description: Configure setup, development, and cleanup scripts for this project.

setup.label: Setup Script
setup.helper: This script will run after creating the worktree and before the coding agent starts. Use it for setup tasks like installing dependencies or preparing the environment.

parallelSetup.label: Run setup script in parallel with agent
parallelSetup.helper: When enabled, the setup script runs concurrently with the coding agent instead of waiting for it to complete first. Useful for long-running setup processes.

dev.label: Dev Server Script
dev.helper: This script can be run from task attempts to start a development server. Use it to quickly start your project's dev server for testing changes.

cleanup.label: Cleanup Script
cleanup.helper: This script runs after coding agent execution only if changes were made. Use it for quality assurance tasks like running linters, formatters, tests, or other validation steps. If no changes are made, this script is skipped.

copyFiles.label: Copy Files
copyFiles.helper: Comma-separated list of files to copy from the original project directory to the worktree. These files will be copied after the worktree is created but before the setup script runs. Useful for environment-specific files like .env, configuration files, and local settings. Make sure these are gitignored or they could get committed!

save.confirmSwitch: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to switch projects? Your changes will be lost.

cliSetup.title: GitHub CLI Setup
cliSetup.description: GitHub CLI authentication is required to create pull requests and interact with GitHub repositories.

steps.checkInstalled: Check if GitHub CLI (gh) is installed
steps.installHomebrew: Install it via Homebrew if needed (macOS)

cliSetup.setupNote: The setup will run in the chat window. You'll need to complete the authentication in your browser.

errors.brewMissing: Homebrew is not installed. Install it to enable automatic setup.
errors.notSupported: Automatic setup is not supported on this platform. Install GitHub CLI manually.
errors.setupFailed: Failed to run GitHub CLI setup.

homebrew.description: Automatic installation requires Homebrew. Install Homebrew from
homebrew.manualInstall: and then rerun the setup. Alternatively, install GitHub CLI manually with:

manual.andAuthenticate: and then authenticate with your GitHub account.
